title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, top NFL Draft prospect, hopes to be mentored by Tom Brady, co-owner of Las Vegas Raiders.
Mendoza, Indiana Hoosiers QB, achieved 41 touchdowns and won Heisman Trophy, marking him as No. 1 draft pick favorite.
Though prospective first pick by Raiders, Mendoza emphasizes he's open to any team in the upcoming NFL Draft.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided during a spring training game but remained in the match after evaluation.
The collision occurred while both players were chasing a fly ball, resulting in temporary down time for both.
Anthony and Rafaela continued to play, each recording hits in subsequent innings against pitcher Chris Sale.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Cora pledges to donate $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund if a 2026 Red Sox player hits 20 home runs.
The Jimmy Fund supports cancer care and research at Boston's Dana-Farber Cancer Institute and has strong ties to the Red Sox.
Previous donations by Cora to Jimmy Fund included $10,407.96 in 2021 for Red Sox wins and $10,777 for runs scored.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The New Hampshire House passed the CHARLIE Act restricting critical race theory and LGBTQ+ topics in schools, 184–164.
The bill, named after activist Charlie Kirk, awaits Senate review, limiting certain pedagogies deemed divisive.
Educators may face disciplinary actions or lawsuits for violations; a 2021 similar law was ruled unconstitutional.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2, North Adams, are made by adding food coloring to ice.
The tradition of coloring icicles in North Adams dates back decades, engaging the community yearly.
The Hairpin Turn, with scenic views, is near attractions like The Golden Eagle Restaurant and MASS MoCA.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts confirms first two measles cases of 2026, involving a school-aged child and an adult in Greater Boston.
The adult case recently returned from abroad and visited multiple locations while infectious, prompting exposure notifications.
Massachusetts Public Health stresses high vaccination rates and vigilance to prevent measles spread amid national outbreak.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, of South Boston, passed away on February 21, 2026, after a brief illness.
She was known for her work at Boston Inspectional Services and appeared in a commercial with Rob Gronkowski.
Morgan is survived by her husband Francis Vitiello, children Mya and Frankie, and a large extended family.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton, 26, from Tampa, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon for The ALS Association in memory of her father.
Hamilton's father, a salesman in Boston, passed away from ALS, inspiring her to raise awareness and support through the marathon.
The race is part of Hamilton's hope for a future with better ALS treatments and support for affected families.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion against Attorney General Andrea Campbell's effort to strike down an audit lawsuit.
The conflict involves DiZoglio suing legislative leaders to enforce a voter-backed audit, opposed by Campbell citing legal procedure.
House Speaker Ron Mariano and Senate President Karen Spilka resist the audit, invoking concerns about separation of powers and privacy.
